metadata.notes: All actionable funding opportunities for solar companies, installers, and homeowners. Priority 1 = highest urgency.

opportunities.name: Commercial Investment Tax Credit (ITC) - Section 48E
opportunities.amount: 30% of system cost (6% base + 5x PWA multiplier)
opportunities.deadline: Begin construction by 2026-07-04; placed in service by 2027-12-31
opportunities.notes: CRITICAL DEADLINE: Safe harbor by July 3, 2026. This is the primary federal incentive remaining. TPO/lease/PPA residential installations qualify via the business credit.

opportunities.name: Domestic Content Bonus Credit
opportunities.notes: MANDATORY for direct pay recipients starting 2026. Track equipment compliance in CRM. US-manufactured panels/inverters/racking required.

opportunities.name: Energy Community Bonus Credit
opportunities.notes: Check every project site against the IRS Energy Community map. Brownfields, coal communities, and fossil fuel employment areas qualify. Can stack with domestic content for 50% total ITC.

opportunities.name: Low-Income Communities Bonus Credit Program
opportunities.amount: +10% to +20% ITC bonus (up to 50-60% total with other adders)
opportunities.notes: APPLICATIONS OPEN NOW. 1.8 GW annual capacity. Initial 30-day period treats all apps equally. Apply ASAP for projects in low-income areas, on Indian Land, or serving affordable housing.

opportunities.name: Section 45X Advanced Manufacturing Production Tax Credit
opportunities.notes: Relevant if manufacturing solar components in the US. Foreign entity restrictions effective 2026. Supports domestic supply chain development.

opportunities.name: Tax Credit Transferability
opportunities.notes: For-profit solar companies can sell unused tax credits to unrelated buyers for cash. Critical monetization path for companies with insufficient tax liability.

opportunities.name: Elective Pay (Direct Pay) for Tax-Exempt Entities
opportunities.deadline: Through 2027-12-31; domestic content REQUIRED for 2026+ projects
opportunities.notes: For nonprofits, governments, tribes, co-ops. Must meet domestic content requirements for 2026+ projects or receive 0% credit. Under 1 MW exempt from domestic content.

opportunities.name: USDA REAP Grants (Rural Energy for America Program)
opportunities.deadline: FY2026 grant window expected October 2026 (rolling for loans)
opportunities.notes: Excellent for rural commercial solar projects. IRA funds provide up to 50% cost share. Caution: ground-mounted solar >50kW on farmland is being deprioritized. Roof-mounted and smaller systems remain fully eligible. Guaranteed loans available NOW.

opportunities.name: USDA REAP Guaranteed Loans
opportunities.notes: Unlike REAP grants which are backlogged, guaranteed loans are still being processed. Available to agricultural producers and rural small businesses.

opportunities.name: USDA Rural Energy Savings Program (RESP)
opportunities.amount: 0% interest loans to rural utilities (re-lent to customers)
opportunities.notes: Rural electric co-ops borrow at 0% from USDA, then re-lend to members for solar and energy efficiency. Partner with rural co-ops to offer solar financing.

opportunities.name: USDA Electric Infrastructure Loan & Loan Guarantee Program
opportunities.notes: For utilities and cooperatives financing generation, transmission, and distribution including solar. Not for individual installers, but relevant for utility-scale partnerships.

opportunities.name: California SGIP (Self-Generation Incentive Program)
opportunities.notes: Major California battery storage incentive. New $280M LMI program with 50% upfront (launched June 2025). Pair every CA solar sale with battery storage to access SGIP.

opportunities.name: California DAC-SASH Program
opportunities.notes: For homeowners in disadvantaged communities. Can cover significant portion of installation cost. Income-qualified.

opportunities.name: Massachusetts SMART 3.0 Program
opportunities.notes: Massachusetts stepped up as federal credits ended. Predictable monthly payments. Higher rates for low-income and solar+storage. Apply early - capacity is limited.

opportunities.name: Massachusetts ConnectedSolutions (Demand Response)
opportunities.agency: National Grid / Eversource / Rhode Island Energy
opportunities.notes: Excellent recurring revenue for battery storage customers. Enroll customers in VPP program for annual payments based on summer peak performance.

opportunities.name: New York NY-Sun Affordable Solar
opportunities.deadline: Ongoing (standard Megawatt Block upstate is CLOSED)
opportunities.notes: Standard upstate residential incentives closed 12/17/2025. Affordable Solar incentives remain for LMI households. NY state 25% tax credit (up to $5,000) still available for all.

opportunities.name: New York State Solar Tax Credit
opportunities.notes: State-level tax credit. Available to all NY homeowners who purchase solar. Does not require federal credit eligibility.

opportunities.name: New Jersey SuSI (Successor Solar Incentive) Program
opportunities.notes: Strong 15-year incentive stream. Fixed-price TRECs provide revenue certainty. NJ also accelerating VPP and storage programs.

opportunities.name: New Jersey Garden State Energy Storage Program
opportunities.notes: New statewide battery storage program. Annual payments for grid support. Pair with SuSI for comprehensive solar+storage value proposition.

opportunities.name: Colorado Community Solar Modernization (SB24-207)
opportunities.amount: Minimum 25% bill discount for LMI subscribers
opportunities.notes: Colorado expanding community solar to 5 MW max size, requiring 51% LMI subscribers, mandating 100 MW utility community solar. New market opportunity.

opportunities.name: Colorado VPP Program (First State VPP)
opportunities.notes: Colorado's first VPP program. Performance-based compensation will drive additional distributed generation and storage adoption.

opportunities.name: Illinois Clean Energy Bill - VPP & Storage
opportunities.notes: Major legislation creating VPP programs and 3 GW storage procurement. Solar+storage market opportunity in Illinois.

opportunities.name: DOE Community Power Accelerator Prize
opportunities.deadline: Check DOE website for current round
opportunities.notes: For new/emerging solar developers, community organizations, local governments, and tribal organizations. Supports multiple community solar projects.

opportunities.name: SolarAPP+ Prize (Local Government Adoption)
opportunities.notes: For local governments adopting SolarAPP+. Not directly for installers, but faster permitting benefits entire local market. Advocate for adoption in target markets.

opportunities.name: LIHEAP Solar Pathway
opportunities.amount: Up to 25% of state LIHEAP funds transferable to solar weatherization
opportunities.notes: $4.05B total LIHEAP funding for FY2026. States can include solar as weatherization measure. Partner with state LIHEAP administrators to enable solar pathways.

opportunities.name: Weatherization Assistance Program (WAP) - Solar Eligible
opportunities.notes: $329M in FY2026 for weatherization including solar. Work with state WAP agencies to ensure solar is included as eligible measure.

opportunities.name: C-PACE Financing (Commercial Property Assessed Clean Energy)
opportunities.amount: 100% of project cost; up to 30-year repayment
opportunities.notes: Available in 30+ states + DC. 100% financing, no upfront cost, repaid via property tax assessment. Transfers with property. Excellent for commercial solar projects.

opportunities.name: Connecticut Green Bank Smart-E Loan
opportunities.notes: First state green bank in the US. Solar, heat pumps, insulation eligible. Also offers C-PACE and low-income solar lease (PosiGen partnership).

opportunities.name: FHA PowerSaver Loan
opportunities.notes: FHA-insured energy improvement loan. 660 min credit score, 45% max DTI. Limited lender participation. Solar PV and thermal eligible.

opportunities.name: DOE Solar Workforce Development Funding
opportunities.notes: For organizations providing solar training, apprenticeships, and workforce development. Solar Ready Vets Network and Solar Training Network.

opportunities.name: DOE Perovskite & Next-Gen Solar R&D
opportunities.notes: For research institutions and manufacturers developing perovskite-silicon tandem cells. Not directly applicable to installers but signals future technology direction.

opportunities.name: Maryland SREC Market
opportunities.notes: Active SREC market. Track market prices via SRECTrade. Each MWh of solar production generates one SREC.

opportunities.name: Delaware SREC Market
opportunities.notes: Active SREC market in Delaware. Smaller market but still generates revenue for solar system owners.

opportunities.name: Virginia SREC Market
opportunities.notes: Growing SREC market. Virginia has ambitious 100% clean by 2050 target driving demand.

opportunities.name: DC SREC Market
opportunities.notes: DC has historically had the highest SREC prices in the country due to aggressive RPS targets and limited roof space.

opportunities.name: North Carolina Duke Energy Progress Solar Rebate
opportunities.notes: Utility-specific rebate in Duke Energy Progress territory. First-come, first-served.

opportunities.name: Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) Solar Incentive
opportunities.notes: Post-installation payment for solar installations in TVA service territory (parts of TN, AL, GA, KY, MS, NC, VA).

opportunities.name: Dominion Energy VPP Pilot (Virginia)
opportunities.deadline: Program proposal submitted; enrollment timeline TBD
opportunities.notes: 450 MW VPP pilot mandated by Virginia legislature in 2025. Enrollment details expected in 2026. Solar+battery customers in Dominion territory should be alerted.

opportunities.name: Green Mountain Power VPP Program (Vermont)
opportunities.notes: Pioneer VPP program. Saved ratepayers ~$3M in summer 2025. Battery customers can enroll for compensation.
